trigger_event: After a rare, tense night at Bar 101, Nikola is approached by messengers from rival Council factions seeking the lost access protocols that only he still remembers. The city is slipping into confusion, and the old world of silent deals is ending.
dilemma: Nikola must decide whether to place his trust in order—handing exclusive system recovery instructions to the Harmonists for a silent recalibration—or to break the old codes entirely by releasing partial recovery information to all factions, exposing the BCI to open struggle.
reason: He knows a single wrong move could either return quiet repression or plunge the city into open chaos, but he cannot ignore the quiet urgency of Alex the bartender, who reminds him of the human cost behind every Council order.
choice_a: Deliver the complete recovery instructions only to the Harmonists, enabling them to quietly restore order and mask instability from the public.
belief_a: Order is safer for the people than open conflict.
The Harmonists, though flawed, value stability over ambition or control.
The city cannot survive a public breakdown—secrecy is a lesser evil.
choice_b: Release partial recovery information to all factions at once, forcing them into open competition and exposing the BCI to public malfunction and blame.
belief_b: Transparency, even chaos, is better than another generation of hidden control.
No single group should be handed the city’s fate in secret.
Shaking the system may force real change, even if it means a difficult transition.
